condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Covenants applicable to project implementation | Description :The Recipient shall ensure, throughout Projectimplementation, the coordination among its offices, units and subordinated agencies/institutions...all with powers, functions,capacity, staffing and resources acceptable to the Association to fulfill their respective responsibilities under the Project. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Covenants applicable to project implementation | Description :The Recipient shall vest the overallresponsibility for the implementation of the Project in the MoF; and to this end, through the MoF, shall operate and maintain,throughout Project implementation, the Administration and Procurement Support Team Unit (APST) withqualified staff in sufficientnumbers, adequate funds, facilities, services and other resources for Project implementation. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Timeliness of changes to personnel records and the payroll (months) (PI-18ii)

actual.value: PEFA 2017 PI1-18ii score = B, no change from baseline (using 2011 methodology)

title.narrative: Improved accountability of public expenditure measured by the quality of annual financial reports (PI-25)

actual.value: The consolidated financial statements of the budget sector was prepared for 2017. The financial statements of the budget sector for2018 is being prepared in 2019.(b) The Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan has developed and approved 10 TPSASstandards, including standards 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12, 17, 22, 24 under the implementation of the first phase of the PFMMP and the firstphase of the introduction of international standards in 2014. Due to the complexity of introduction of standards 12 and 17, theintroduction of these standards was postponed to the second phase of the introduction of international standards.The Ministry ofFinance of the Republic of Tajikistan has developed and approved 4 TPSAS standards, including standards 23, 28, 29 и 30 under theimplementation of the second phase of the PFMMP and the second phase of the introduction of international standards in 2017 andthey were officially registered in the Ministry of Justice of the Republic of Tajikistan. The technical

title.narrative: Improved accountability of public expenditures measured by the quality of financial audit (PI-26)

actual.value: According to preliminary data of the Chamber of Account of RT as of end 2020, the central government entities representing lessthan 73% of total expenditures were covered by audits.

title.narrative: Improved effectiveness of public expenditure measured by the increased alignment of expenditure with policy priorities (PI-12)

actual.value: There are many different development strategies (plans, programs) for different sectors. The comprehensive sectoral strategy wasapproved by the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan only in the education sector and this Strategy is valid until 2020.InFebruary 2020 after agreement with all interested ministries, the draft Law "On strategic planning and state forecasting ofdevelopment" was submitted to the Executive Office of the President of the Republic of Tajikistan (EOP RT). After reviewing andbased on the conclusion of the Legal Department of the EOP RT, this draft was sent for finalization. At the request of theComponent 4 Leader, the legal consultant was hired to finalize this draft law. Currently taking into account the comments andproposals of the Legal Department of the EOP RT, the draft law has been finalized and submitted to the working group for itsreview.

title.narrative: Improved control of public expenditure measured by the stock of expenditure payment arrears (PI-4)

actual.value: PEFA 2017 Score of C+ PI-4 (using 2011 Methodology) - Data on stock of arrears is not published, but is provided to external audit,the Government and the Parliament of Republic of Tajikistan

title.narrative: The number of services available through e-Governance system

baseline.value: No services available on e-Gov system

actual.value: Softline-IT Company has developed all 8 e-Government Modules and 3 e-Document flow Modules in the EOP RT. All employees of the EOPRT were trained on working with these Modules. In October 2020 training was conducted for the employees of the ICT Center and theDepartment of Records Management and Control of the EOP RT. All Modules are being tested by the staff of the ICT Center. It isplanned to launch Module 9 (electronic document flow) in test mode from January 2021. Also the list of 5 electronic public serviceshas been determined, which will be put into operation in test mode.

title.narrative: Key procurement information is made available to the public in a timely manner through appropriate means (PI-19iii)

actual.value: In 2017 the Agency on Public Procurement of Goods, Works and Services under the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan under thesupport of the World Bank has modernized the e-procurement portal of the Republic of Tajikistan, including the creation of abiddingmodule with unlimited and limited participation, improvement of the electronic request for quotations module and improvementof information sections of the web portal of public procurement, other functional capabilities and a subsystem for differentiatingthe user rights to information resources of the information system. The mechanisms and interfaces are implemented in the electronicprocurement information system in accordance with OCDS (open contracting data standard). Currently, the procurement procedures arecarried out through the Unified Public Procurement Portal, the reports are generated on the portal automatically, all procuringentities are covered by annual procurement reports, the data of which are published on the portal

The financial reporting on a cash basis in accordance with budget classification is submitted to the Government of the Republic ofTajikistan, the Parliament of the Republic of Tajikistan and the External Audit (Chamber of Accounts of the Republic of Tajikistan)within 6 months of the end of the fiscal year. The financial reporting on an accrual basis in accordance with TPSAS is formed,however a transition period to 2020 is determined by the Public Sector Accounting Strategy in which the formed financial reportingon an accrual basis is trial and is not submitted to external audit. (b) A roadmap has been developed for the application ofTPSFRS for the period of 2019-2024.

title.narrative: Total value of contracts that were awarded through an open and competitive process (PI-19ii)

actual.value: In 2019, the Agency on Public Procurement of Goods, Works and Services under the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan hasconducted 1200 tender procedures, 68 of which were procurements from a single source, which are not an open competition. All otherprocurements are conducted in an open and competitive process which ratio is 94.33%.

title.narrative: Coverage of external audit (in percent of total expenditure) (PI-26i)

actual.value: According to preliminary data of the Chamber of Account of RT as of end 2020, the central government entities representing lessthan 73% of total expenditures were covered by audits.

title.narrative: Additional functionalities (modules) of TFMIS (commitment control, cash management, payment order processing, assets management andpayroll management) installed and operational

baseline.value: none of the 5 modules are operational

actual.value: The bank payment management module has been implemented since 2017.Cash management, liability management and asset managementmodules have been developed. Currently, the final testing and training of the employees of the Ministry of Finance of the Republicof Tajikistan and the central-level MABAs are being conducted. The Ministry of Finance has made a decision on the phasedintroduction of these modules.From 2021, these modules will be launched for at least 10 MABAs.It is planned to connect all thecentral-level MABAs to these modules by the end of 2021, and to connect all the local-level MABAs within 2022-2023.The humanresource management module has been developed and it is planned to launch it from 2021 for organizations having civil servants intheir staff.

title.narrative: Evidence of follow up on audit recommendations (in percent of audit recommendations) (PI-26iii)

actual.value: According to preliminary data of the Chamber of Account of RT as of end 2020, the accomplishment of audit recommendations isevaluated at the level of 87%.

title.narrative: Beneficiaries satisfied with systems and procedures implemented by the Project, as measured by user satisfaction surveys (percent of users surveyed)
Percent of women beneficiaries satisfied with systems and procedures implemented by the Project, as measured by user satisfaction surveys
Project supported NGO publishing reports on feedback received and how this feedback has been used.
Audits performed and audited financial statements submitted by largest SOEs
PIM methodology is applied in ministries covering economic analysis of investment proposals, project selection, costing and monitoring.

target.value: 3 pilots conducted using the PIM methodology developed by the Project

title.narrative: Internal audits coverage is increased and quality of internal audit function is risk-based and complies with international standards (PI-21i)

target.value: Consistent monitoring of SOE performance using system developed under the Project
